perturbation.original_text: This Amendment No. 3 (“Amendment No. 3") to the Nonexclusive Value Added Distributor Agreement, as amended ("Agreement''), by and between Cisco Systems, Inc. ("Cisco"), a California corporation having Its principal place of business at 170 West Tasman Drive, San Jose, CA, 95134, and ScanSource, Inc. ("Distributor"), a South Carolina corporation with a place of business at 6 Logue Court, Greenville, South Carolina, 29615, is effective as of the date last signed below ("Amendment Effective Date”). All capitalized terms contained herein shall have the same meaning as the terms defined in the Agreement unless specifically modified in this Amendment.
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment No. 3 (“Amendment No. 3") to the Nonexclusive Value Added Distributor Agreement, as amended ("Agreement''), by and between Cisco Systems, Inc. ("Cisco"), a California corporation having Its principal place of business at 170 West Tasman Drive, San Jose, CA, 95134, and ScanSource, Inc. ("Reseller"), a South Carolina corporation with a place of business at 6 Logue Court, Greenville, South Carolina, 29615, is effective as of the date last signed below ("Amendment Effective Date”). All capitalized terms contained herein shall have the same meaning as the terms defined in the Agreement unless specifically modified in this Amendment.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Distributor' to 'Reseller' without defining 'Reseller' creates ambiguity. The agreement refers to ScanSource, Inc. as 'Distributor' in some places and 'Reseller' in others without clarifying if these terms are interchangeable. This could lead to disputes over rights and responsibilities if the terms are interpreted differently.

perturbation.original_text: 12.1 Distributor shall have the option to return to Cisco, for credit, up [*****] of the dollar value of Products from the Wholesale Price List (or, if no Wholesale Price Lists exists for Distributor's Territory, then the applicable price list) shipped to Distributor, net of credits, less returns to Cisco, in the preceding [*****] period (the "Balancing Cap") of the preceding Cisco fiscal quarter. The above-referenced cap shall be determined based on all Product purchases made under this Agreement. The responsibility to manage the Balancing Cap shall rest solely upon Distributor. Distributor shall be entitled to return Product once per quarter, provided such returns do not exceed the Balancing Cap. "Dead on Arrival" and Obsolete Products returned pursuant to Section 13 of this Agreement shall be excluded from calculation of the Balancing Cap. Cisco shall credit Distributor's account in the amount of the price paid by Distributor therefore, less any price protection credits issued to Distributor related to the Product returned (the "Return Credit").
perturbation.changed_text: 12.1 The Retailer shall have the option to return to Cisco, for credit, up [*****] of the dollar value of Products from the Wholesale Price List (or, if no Wholesale Price Lists exists for Distributor's Territory, then the applicable price list) shipped to Distributor, net of credits, less returns to Cisco, in the preceding [*****] period (the "Balancing Cap") of the preceding Cisco fiscal quarter. The above-referenced cap shall be determined based on all Product purchases made under this Agreement. The responsibility to manage the Balancing Cap shall rest solely upon Distributor. The Retailer shall be entitled to return Product once per quarter, provided such returns do not exceed the Balancing Cap. "Dead on Arrival" and Obsolete Products returned pursuant to Section 13 of this Agreement shall be excluded from calculation of the Balancing Cap. Cisco shall credit Distributor's account in the amount of the price paid by The Retailer therefore, less any price protection credits issued to Distributor related to the Product returned (the "Return Credit").
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Retailer' in the first sentence of section 12.1 and some other parts, but not consistently throughout the section. The section is still referencing to 'Distributor' in the middle. This creates an internal contradiction: is it the 'Retailer' or the 'Distributor' who manages the Balancing Cap and can return product? The term is being used interchangeably without definition.

21.1 In connection with the sale or distribution of Cisco Products or Services, or otherwise in carrying out its obligations under this Agreement, Distributor represents and warrants the following:
(a) Distributor will comply with all country, federal, state and local laws, ordinances, codes, regulations, rules, policies and procedures, Including, without limitation, all anti-corruption laws, Including, the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (Applicable Laws). Distributor can find more information about the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act at the following URL: http://www.usdoj.gov/criminal/fraud/docs/dojdocb.html, or by contacting publicsectorcompllance@cisco.com.

21.1 In connection with the sale or distribution of Cisco Products or Services, or otherwise in carrying out its obligations under this Agreement, the Partner represents and warrants the following:
(a) The Sales Agent will comply with all country, federal, state and local laws, ordinances, codes, regulations, rules, policies and procedures, Including, without limitation, all anti-corruption laws, Including, the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (Applicable Laws). perturbation.explanation: Here, in section 21.1, 'Distributor' is changed to 'Partner' in the first paragraph and 'Sales Agent' in the immediate next. Because both term names exist in the same section, an uncertainty as to which entity has which obligations arises. This creates confusion regarding compliance responsibilities.
